column5: Not accurate. I can't downrig for Lake Trout over the summer out of a kayak.  Plus what drifter said. Every spot on every lake is fair game in winter. I look forward to it because my species Target changes.
Yes, this....exactly! Ease of mobility to waters you can't access easily during the softwater season.  s.
Yes, this....exactly! Ease of mobility to waters you can't access easily during the softwater season.  s.   My winter feast is whities. I dont need to go any further then my back door. LOL

I have a Frabill Magnum 2 person tow behind that I'm going to put skis on as well. I have an old pair of downhill skis that I'll cut down and mount to the bottom. I don't think I'll lift it as much as in the pic shown but maybe 2-3" max. I also bought a new skidoo and trailer this year. Other than that I have some repair work to do to my auger and maybe a new battery for my 6 yr old Hummingbird flasher. Can't wait for the snow and ice season.

I have a Frabill Magnum 2 person tow behind that I'm going to put skis on as well. I have an old pair of downhill skis that I'll cut down and mount to the bottom. I don't think I'll lift it as much as in the pic shown but maybe 2-3" max. I also bought a new skidoo and trailer this year. Other than that I have some repair work to do to my auger and maybe a new battery for my 6 yr old Hummingbird flasher. Can't wait for the snow and ice season.   Matt, if you're dragging it behind your sled no need to lift it at all. Make sure to put some UHMW runners on it though to protect the tub from sharp ice.
Matt, if you're dragging it behind your sled no need to lift it at all. Make sure to put some UHMW runners on it though to protect the tub from sharp ice. Good advise! Thanks!

Matt, if you're dragging it behind your sled no need to lift it at all. Make sure to put some UHMW runners on it though to protect the tub from sharp ice. Here is my hut behind my Safari, I found the angle of the bar caused the bar to pinch on the top rim of the hut. My new sled will sit higher at the hitch making the problem worse. If I lift it 2-3" then I won't have that problem (as much). Always gotta tinker with something lol
I built my own hitch using 3/4" EMT, eye bolts and carabiners. No binding.
I built my own hitch using 3/4" EMT, eye bolts and carabiners. No binding.   Nice! Now that I see that, maybe if I put a slight bend in my tow bars it will pull better. Great idea!
I just wish we get cold and a good foot of ice before the snow screws everything up.
November is a month I really look forward to for open water trout fishing, some of the best of the year, with grouse hunting in the mix.  I couldn't imagine not taking advantage of that.
That all happens in October up here.

The lakes can't freeze soon enough for me.  S.  X2. Was shown a new to me spot towards the end of the ice season on Simcoe  last winter. Just killed perch and mostly all good sized ones...very few throwbacks.  Can't wait to see what it's like during the first half of the season.  Always have enjoyed and looked forward to the ice season. This coming season even more.
We are long over due for an ice fish bud. Lets get 'er done this year!  S.

Well with the graphs showing all my rivers up here blown, I took advantage of getting ready.  Made a ply wood retainer this year for the sand bags. 200 pounds per side. Man that truck rides so smooth with this weight.   The hut and smitty fit nice. Enough room for the auger beside it and my 2 milk crates. Fits like a glove.The 5X ELITE is back in it,s ice bag as well.  Yes way to early, lots of steel heading to be done still, but Im ready.
We are long over due for an ice fish bud. Lets get 'er done this year!  S.  Sounds like a plan
-2 here and 10" of snow, great
Then you could probably use this.. LOL  Bought Leah her own sled on Thursday, so we're not doing dumb stuff riding 2up again and 25miles from Camp.  SHOWROOM condition 1995 Polaris Indy Trail Deluxe
I have a sled lol  What I need right now is a hydraulic Jack to get this 20 ft trailer unstuck
had snow stay on the ground in PAB this weekend. Calling for a low of -13 on friday night...soon boys, soon! Ive got one more weekend of hardcore softwater fishing and then ill be ready for ice.
Think Muskoka will be 'good to go by' next week???
Think Muskoka will be 'good to go by' next week???  water was only 46 on saturday...i was in shock with how warm the fall was, she cooled off fast!
That's a nice fish hut B.

I plan on ice fishing daily this winter. Fishing my Rolling Rock out of the ice in the cooler sitting on some pier in Florida for the month of January, maybe longer. Starting in Charlotte Harbor and work our way down to the Keys. Come on ice fishing.
I'm looking at doing some work to my sleigh so it's easier to pull and will carry more.  Saw this one and figured this one would fly with all those stickers on it.

I'm waiting with cash in hand to buy a brand new otter flip over. I want an insulated model. Time to buy the one I've always wanted. Problem is nobody has them in stock yet.....   The lakes can't freeze soon enough for me.  S.
LOL  It would take me 5 minutes tops to be loaded up and gone. Everything is ready to go.
Glad I live close to the Niagara River, open water all winter
Almost time for me to ready the snowmobile and fire up the auger.
Got out this morning for a shore fish, lots of snow, no ice, but soooooooon!  Cant wait to hit the ice!
How are the roads dood?  We got freezing rain overnight, just started snowing about an hour ago  I'm like Brian, 5 mins be ready to go
I can be ready reeel fast! Where's the ice??
Not even close
Got out this morning for a shore fish, lots of snow, no ice, but soooooooon!  Cant wait to hit the ice!        Great picture Simon  BRING IT
Can't wait to get out. This November I really have to prep my gear rather then the first time I go out on the ice with B or nick being like 'What the *%+* was I doing last year?'

Can't wait to get out. This November I really have to prep my gear rather then the first time I go out on the ice with B or nick being like 'What the *%+* was I doing last year?'   Please, this season, show up in winter gear, not your spongebob PJ,s.  LOL

My gear is in the sled, in the shed.  I can wait a good long while for ice, as there is lots of other fishing to be done.  Freeze up would be ideal around Jan 15th.  That gives me November and December for browns and bows, First couple weeks of Jan for Niagara and then a few months of ice.  Good enough for me!

My gear is in the sled, in the shed.  I can wait a good long while for ice, as there is lots of other fishing to be done.  Freeze up would be ideal around Jan 15th.  That gives me November and December for browns and bows, First couple weeks of Jan for Niagara and then a few months of ice.  Good enough for me!  When I lived in Brampton in the early 80,s, I was in the same mind set. I was in the middle of the winterfest. South open water,north the covered waters.  Living in Barrie, and I still have the same decisions, but travel is much less. The winters are not the same. Rivers here are open in December and lakes are not harden up. So traveling is much less ,when I decide where to go. Nice to have the best of both I would say.
I allllways wear those on the ice. Sometimes I run races in them.
Lots of softwater fishing to do!   Smallies are on fire!

Where I live, everything is a drive, unless I want to catch Browns and specs or fish a reservoir.  Closest steelhead is about an hour.  Everything else is 1.5-2.  I'm used to traveling these days LOL.  It's worth it to live in farm country.

I'm waiting with cash in hand to buy a brand new otter flip over. I want an insulated model. Time to buy the one I've always wanted. Problem is nobody has them in stock yet.....   The lakes can't freeze soon enough for me.  S.  Saw an insulated Otter at Cabelas this evening.
Their prices are nuts, arent they. Which model was it?  S.

still got a month of slaying eyes and monster pike to do, maybe ill even stumble across a Gbay Ski...we shall see.  Throw some fatty smallies in the mix...come december ill be ready, but not quite yet.

Their prices are nuts, arent they. Which model was it?  S. Can't remember name of model but it was freaking large.  I could stand up in middle and you could probably use 4' rods in there without banging the roof or walls.
Probably the resort XT. I am looking at a lodge, or possibly the resort if the price is right. Go big or go home I suppose.  S
Great pic Simon ! ... my boats out of the water now .... looking forward to the ice season

People go ice fishing because the dam lakes freeze over not because you need ice to catch fish. lol Year round open water suits me fine. I lived north of "Buried", Ont for years and just don't miss the long winters.

People go ice fishing because the dam lakes freeze over not because you need ice to catch fish. lol Year round open water suits me fine. I lived north of "Buried", Ont for years and just don't miss the long winters.   Ice and snow gives me the opportunity to fish lakes that are fly in access only during the open water season.
